content:
Charles F. Reynolds III, M.D., has a distinguished academic background. He earned his undergraduate degree from Yale University and his medical degree (M.D.) from the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. After obtaining his M.D., he completed his residency in psychiatry at the University of Pittsburgh's Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic.

Dr. Reynolds is a board-certified psychiatrist with a specialization in geriatric psychiatry. His research, teaching, and clinical expertise primarily focus on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of mood and sleep disorders in older adults.
